relation: The default prefix limit was increased for IPv4 unicast, IPv6 unicast, VPNv4 unicast, and VPNv6 unicast address families as: IPv4 unicast: 1048576 IPv6 unicast: 524288 VPNv4 unicast: 2097152
pageTitle: Cisco ASR 9000 Series Aggregation Services Router Routing Command Reference, Release 4.3.x - BGP Commands [Cisco ASR 9000 Series Aggregation Services Routers] - Cisco
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {816401=IPv4 MDT: 131072, 815979=IPv6 Multicast: 131072, 814916=IPv4 Labeled-unicast: 131072, 292266=The following example shows how to divide the autonomous system into autonomous systems 4001, 4002, 4003, 4004, 4005, 4006, and 4007 with the confederation identifier 5. Neighbor 10.2.3.4 is a router inside the confederation. Neighbor 172.20.16.6 is outside the routing domain confederation. To the outside world, there appears to be a single autonomous system with the number 5., 1023286=Size, in bytes, of the receive-side socket buffer. textBeforeTable: Syntax Description accept-own no [inheritance-disable] accept-own To enable handling of self-originated VPN routes containing ACCEPT_OWN community attribute, use the accept-own command in neighbor VPNv4 or VPNv6 address family configuration mode. To disable this functionality, either use the no form of this command or use the command with inheritance-disable keyword. accept-own weight vrf (BGP) username (rpki-server) use update wait-install update-source update out logging update in error-handling extended update in error-handling basic disable update limit sub-group update limit address-family update limit ttl-security transport (rpki-server) timers bgp timers (BGP) table-policy svd platform enable speaker-id soft-reconfiguration inbound socket send-buffer-size socket receive-buffer-size site-of-origin (BGP) signalling disable shutdown (rpki-server) shutdown (BGP) show svd state show svd role show protocols (BGP) show bgp vrf imported-routes show bgp update-group show bgp truncated-communities show bgp summary nsr show bgp summary show bgp sessions
textAfterTable: Release Modification Release 4.1.1 This command was introduced. Usage Guidelines To use this command, you must be in a user group associated with a task group that includes appropriate task IDs. If the user group assignment is preventing you from using a command, contact your AAA administrator for assistance. Task ID Task ID Operation bgp read, write Examples This example shows how to enable handling of accept-own community:  RP/0/RSP0/CPU0:router#configure RP/0/RSP0/CPU0:router(config)#router bgp 100 RP/0/RSP0/CPU0:router(config-bgp)#neighbor 10.2.3.4 RP/0/RSP0/CPU0:router(config-bgp-nbr)#address-family vpnv4 unicast RP/0/RSP0/CPU0:router(config-bgp-nbr-af)#accept-own additional-paths install backup Note Effective with Release 4.0.0, the additional-paths install backup command was deprecated and replaced by the additional-paths selection command.
